item.title: Amazon AMS
item.description: Community Resources Resource Link source https://aws.amazon.com/security/security-bulletins/AWS-2021-006/ Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL CVE-2021-4104: Not vuln ; CVE-2021-44228: Fix NCSC-NL Work in progress, portion of customers may still be vulnerable. Actively monitoring this issue, and are working on addressing it for any AMS services which use Log4j2 Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-20 12:37:57 NCSC-NL Updated vendorPatchExists.

item.title: Amazon AWS
item.description: Community Notes Source Note CISAGov Notes: Amazon Linux 1 had aws apitools which were Java based but these were deprecated in 2015 AWS Forum. AMIs used to inspect and verify (base spin ups) - amzn-ami-hvm-2018.03.0.20200318.1-x86_64-gp2 and amzn2-ami-kernel-5.10-hvm-2.0.20211201.0-x86_64-gp2 CISAGov Last Update: 12/15/2021 Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-21 22:43:46 CISAGov Updated communityNotVulnerable. Updated community note.

Updated community note.

item.title: Amazon AWS EKS, ECS, Fargate
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link Update for Apache Log4j2 Issue (CVE-2021-44228) https://aws.amazon.com/security/security-bulletins/AWS-2021-006/ Community Notes Source Note CISAGov To help mitigate the impact of the open-source Apache “Log4j2" utility (CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2021-45046) security issues on customers’ containers, Amazon EKS, Amazon ECS, and AWS Fargate are deploying a Linux-based update (hot-patch). This hot-patch will require customer opt-in to use, and disables JNDI lookups from the Log4J2 library in customers’ containers.
